articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Returns after Visiting Egypt
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Returns after Visiting Egypt
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA), Tuesday returned home after visiting Egypt to participate in an opening ceremony of the new Suez Canal.
					 He was greeted by Vice-President of the SPA Presidium Yang Hyong Sop, Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, Vice Foreign Minister Ri Kil Song and Charge d'Affaires ad Interim of the Egyptian embassy here Karim Mohamed Hossameldin Hassan Gouda.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Flood Damage
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Flood Damage
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the flood damage in South Hwanghae Province.
					 Torrential rain and tsunami hit the province early this month, leaving breakwaters partially destroyed and dwelling houses, roads, railways and bridges inundated and damaged.
					
					 Farmland in some areas was inundated and washed away, making it hard to expect any harvest.
					
					 Going round several afflicted areas in Haeju City, Pyoksong and Sinwon counties, he learned about the damage there.
					
					 The consultative meeting convened on the spot discussed the issue of conducting the work for recovering from damage, directing primary efforts to bringing the living of the people in the afflicted areas to normal.
					
					 Earlier, the premier toured various places of Wonsan and Munchon cities, Kangwon Province. He underlined the need to speed up the road reconstruction and railway construction as befitting the tourist city, successfully operate the Wonsan Baby Home and Orphanage and improve the performance of the newly produced farm machines.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Nigerian Ambassador to DPRK
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Nigerian Ambassador to DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday met and had a talk with Nigerian Ambassador to the DPRK Nwofe Alexander who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Chairman of Syrian Arab-Korea Friendship Association
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Chairman of Syrian Arab-Korea Friendship Association
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from Fairouz Al-Mousa, chairman of the Syrian Arab-Korea Friendship Association.
					 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned on Tuesday by the chairman who is a member of the Regional Leadership of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party and director of the Higher Education Department of the party. He is visiting the DPRK as head of the delegation of the association.

articles.title: Abducted DPRK Citizen Returns from Japan
articles.content:
Abducted DPRK Citizen Returns from Japan
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- To Yong Suk, a DPRK citizen who had been abducted and taken to Japan, came back home and met with her family, according to a notice by a relevant organ.
					 She is a Korean repatriate from Japan.

articles.title: Lebanese Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Lebanese Delegation Arrives
						
Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Democratic Youth Union of Lebanon headed by Chairman Hassan Zeitouny arrived here on Tuesday.

articles.title: Delegation of Koreans in Japan Arrives
articles.content:
Delegation of Koreans in Japan Arrives
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Koreans in Japan led by Pak Ku Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, arrived here Tuesday to celebrate the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations Arrive
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations Arrive
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Foreign delegations arrived here on Tuesday to participate in the international solidarity event for celebrating the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 They included a delegation of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association headed by Chairman Anders Kristensen and a delegation of the Korean Friendship Association (KFA) led by Alejandro Cao de Benos, chairman of the KFA headquartered in Spain, Helmi El Hadidi, chairman of the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Organization, and Kosima Weber Liu, executive director of the Environmental Education Media Project.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Delegations Here
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Delegations Here
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Delegations of overseas Koreans arrived here on Tuesday to participate in the conference for national reunification for celebrating the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 They included a delegation of Koreans in Japan led by Ri Tong Je, chairman of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification, a delegation of the International United Confederation of Koreans led by First Vice-Chairman Kim Chil Song, a delegation of the Federation of Koreans in Canada headed by Chairman Kim Su Hae, a delegation of the Joint Secretariat of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification led by Rim Min Sik, chairman of the Overseas Headquarters of the alliance, and a delegation of the Confederation of South Koreans in Japan for Democracy and Reunification led by Chairman Son Hyong Gun.

articles.title: Delegation of Japan-DPRK Friendship Study for Juche Departs
articles.content:
Delegation of Japan-DPRK Friendship Study for Juche Departs
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Japan-DPRK friendship study for Juche headed by Masaji Ie, co-representative of the Japanese National Liaison Council of Societies for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, departed here for home on Tuesday.

articles.title: Delegation of Korea-Mongolia Friendship Parliamentary Group Back Home
articles.content:
Delegation of Korea-Mongolia Friendship Parliamentary Group Back Home
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korea-Mongolia Friendship Parliamentary Group headed by Chairman Thae Hyong Chol, president of Kim Il Sung University and minister of Higher Education, returned home on Tuesday after visiting Mongolia.

articles.title: DPRK Figure Skaters Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Figure Skaters Back Home
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- DPRK figure skaters came back home Tuesday after winning gold medals at the 2015 figure skating tournament for Asian Cup.
					 The tournament held in Thailand from August 5 brought together at least 120 ace men and women players from 14 countries including the DPRK, Indonesia, Hong Kong, China and region.
					
					 The DPRK players bagged 3 gold medals, 2 silver and 2 bronze medals.
					
					 Hong Il won a gold medal in men's individual event of junior second class, Choe Hyang Rim in women's individual event of junior second class and Kim Kwon Phyong in men's individual event of junior third class.
					
					 Ro Yong Myong and Kim Kwon Yong placed second in men's individual events of junior first class and third class respectively and Han Kum Chol and Ri Ju Won came third in men's individual events of youth class and junior third class respectively.

articles.title: Members of Cuban Embassy Visit Historic Site Associated with History of Fatherland Liberation War
articles.content:
Members of Cuban Embassy Visit Historic Site Associated with History of Fatherland Liberation War
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK German Hermin Ferras Alvarez and staff members of his embassy toured the historic site associated with the history of the Fatherland Liberation War Tuesday on the month of solidarity with the Cuban people.
					 Being briefed on the fact that President Kim Il Sung beat back the U.S. imperialist aggressors, who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world, with the Juche-oriented military idea, unique strategies and tactics and outstanding commanding art, the guests looked round the supreme command post, monument to the revolutionary activities, operation room and other places.
					
					 They also toured some historic relics associated with the traces of leader Kim Jong Il, who nurtured the wisdom and grit of the Paektu brilliant commander while staying near the operation table of the Supreme Command during the war.

articles.title: KPA Service Personnel Participating in Red Flag Relay Visit Sinchon Museum
articles.content:
KPA Service Personnel Participating in Red Flag Relay Visit Sinchon Museum
						
 Sinchon, August 11 (KCNA) -- Service personnel of the Korean People's Army (KPA) running in the west coastal area for red flag relay conducted diverse political and cultural activities including meetings to learn about the greatness of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, meetings for education in faith and sports games at various units including the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the KPA.
					 They visited the Sinchon Museum on Tuesday.
					
					 After being briefed that the museum was built as a base for education against imperialism and the U.S. and and for class education, they went round it.
					
					 They held a meeting to pledge revenge.
					
					 Present there were generals, officers and soldiers of the KPA.
					
					 Ju Sang Won, honorary curator of the museum, referring to the brutal killing of innocent people by the U.S. imperialist aggressors and the class enemies in Sinchon, asked the soldiers for a thousand-fold revenge on them.
					
					 KPA officer Kim Jong Su and non-commissioned officer Choe Kum Sok said that during the days of the project for building the museum they keenly felt once again during the U.S. imperialists and class enemies were a group of cannibals regarding massacre of human beings as hobby, adding this made them whet the class sword more and more sharply.
					
					 Non-commissioned officer Ri Hyok Chol and others expressed their will to inflict a shameless final ruin on the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 At the end of the meeting a live bullet firing contest of the service personnel took place.
					
					 They marched for Panmunjom.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- A home-visiting group of Koreans in Japan visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Tuesday.
					 The members of the group laid bunches of flowers before the statues and made a bow to them.

articles.title: Rangrim Revolutionary Battle Site Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
articles.content:
Rangrim Revolutionary Battle Site Draws Endless Stream of Visitors 
						
 Rangrim, August 11 (KCNA) -- Service personnel, people of various strata and school youth and children are visiting the Rangrim Revolutionary Battle Site every day on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 The battle site is associated with the revolutionary exploits of President Kim Il Sung and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk. They advanced to the Rangrim area late in the 1930s to expand the armed struggle to the homeland and guided preparations for actively greeting the great event of national liberation.
					
					 An endless stream of visitors are calling on Wagalbong Secret Camp, the basic secret base in Mt. Rangrim which operated as a regional base for guiding an all-people resistance and an operational, action and logistic base of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army, during the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					 Kim Il Sung came to the land of Rangrim several times in August and September, Juche 27 (1938) and guided meetings of small units and political operatives and led them to prepare well for the all-people resistance.
					
					 Going round the log cabin of the headquarters, room of guards, etc. visitors learned about the great efforts made by the President to make thorough preparations for greeting the great event of national liberation.
					
					 They looked round the historic relics and trees bearing slogans in Janggol Bivouac, Sodongsan Secret Camp, Suchaegol Secret Camp and others.
					
					 In the Insan area of the Rangrim Revolutionary Battle Site associated with feats of Kim Jong Suk, they went round several places of the battle site, recollecting the revolutionary feats she performed by telling fire-field farmers about legendary stories about Kim Il Sung and arousing them to the anti-Japanese patriotic struggle.

articles.title: Performance Given by Successful Participants in Vocal Solo and Instrument Solo Contest
articles.content:
Performance Given by Successful Participants in Vocal Solo and Instrument Solo Contest
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- A performance was given by successful participants of vocal solo and instrument solo contest among officials and members of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea at the Jangchon Vegetable Co-op Farm in Sadong District, Pyongyang City, on Aug. 11 to celebrate the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation. 
					 The performance began with chorus "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung". Put on the stage were such colorful numbers as female solo "Star of Korea", an immortal revolutionary hymn, and male solo "Red Chol Pass".
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the revolutionary feats President Kim Il Sung performed by accomplishing the historic cause of the country's liberation.
					
					 Put on the stage were such numbers as female solos "When We Walk along the Road between Fields" and "A Beautiful Home" which tell about the dedication of the President.
					
					 Their repertoire included such numbers as mixed quintet "We Will Go to Mt. Paektu" and male solo "Oh, My Motherland of Songun" reflecting the revolutionary faith and patriotism of the agricultural workers to remain true to the Songun leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Among the audience were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the C.C., the union, officials concerned, officials of the union and agricultural workers.

articles.title: DPRK-Russia Stamp Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
DPRK-Russia Stamp Exhibition Opens
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- A DPRK-Russia stamp exhibition opened here under the co-sponsorship of the Philatelists Union of Korea and the Russian National Philatelists Academy to mark the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 On display at the venue of the exhibition hall was a photo depicting a stamp bearing portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Also on show were stamps on the themes of the exploits the President performed by liberating the country, validity and vitality of the Songun politics pursued by the Workers' Party of Korea, the victory of Russia in the great Patriotic War and the DPRK-Russia friendly relations, and other stamps presented by philatelists of the DPRK and Russia.
					
					 An opening ceremony took place at the Korean Stamp Exhibition House on Tuesday.
					
					 Present there were Kim Yong Gil, chairman of the Philatelists Union of Korea, Kim Jin Bom, chairman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association who doubles as vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned, Pyongyangites, philatelists, Alexandr Minaev, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Russian embassy here, and his embassy officials, Russian guests staying here and foreign diplomatic envoys here.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants looked round stamps on display.

articles.title: Juche-oriented Fine Arts Created during Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle
articles.content:
Tradition of Juche-oriented Fine Art Created during Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The tradition of Juche-oriented fine art was created during the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle waged by the Korean revolutionaries under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Regarding the fine art as a powerful means for ideological education, the President set forth the idea and theory on the Juche-oriented development of fine art and wisely led the work to realize them.
					
					 In this period, model art pieces had been created in different forms characterized by great cogency and strong appeal.
					
					 Typical of them are the Korean painting "Revolutionary's Fidelity", poster "Appeal to Fellow Countrymen", woodcut "Light from Headquarters", mimeographed painting "A Bugler" and illustration "O My Dear Motherland!"
					
					 A progress had been also made in embroidery, calligraphy and stage arts.
					
					 Among them are the embroidery "Motherland Alive with Blooming Hibiscus" done by anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk and slogan-bearing trees.
					
					 The artistic representation of the leader in the DPRK was originated from those art pieces portraying Kim Il Sung created in the period, among which are the Korean painting "Kim Il Sung, Tiger of Mt. Paektu" and woodcut "Commander Kim Il Sung Mapping out an Operation Plan".
					
					 Now, the Juche-oriented fine art created during the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle has been brought into full bloom as a genuine art serving the popular masses in the DPRK.

articles.title: River Improvement Project Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
River Improvement Project Brisk in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- A river improvement project is going on at a fast tempo in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 According to data available, dredging and embankment were carried out in scores of rivers and streams throughout the country in the recent two months. In total, a section extending tens of kilometers was dredged up and embanked to prevent flooding.
					
					 Various cities and counties of South Phyongan Province finished such project in their areas. In particular, officials and residents in Anju City removed more than 23 000 cubic meters of earth and built over 600 meters of embankment in the Ryonghwa Dyke No. 4 after concluding the embankment project on Kumgang Islet in 50 days.
					
					 Similar project has been conducted in North Phyongan, South Hamgyong, and other provinces of the country.

articles.title: New Acrobatic Pieces Produced
articles.content:
New Acrobatic Pieces Produced
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The National Circus in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has recently produced new acrobatic pieces.
					 Physical acrobatics "Rotation on Parallel Bars", performed by eight acrobats, shows the high physical capability and artistic skills through various movements of high technique.
					
					 The newly-produced acrobatic pieces also include physical acrobatics "Hand Feats with Rings", which is performed by a female acrobat with rings of various sizes.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Urges U.S. to Show Sincere Will for Dialogue
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Urges U.S. to Show Sincere Will for Dialogue
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- High-ranking officials of the U.S. Department of State recently claimed that the U.S. is keeping the door of dialogue open but the DPRK is reluctant to come out for it and if it takes other way, the U.S. will take flexible approach to it. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in an article in this regard:
					
					 The DPRK continues proposing dialogue with broad magnanimity to defuse tension and create a peaceful environment on the Korean peninsula but the U.S. raises preconditions for it, declining to respond.
					
					 Earlier this year, also, the DPRK expressed the stand that it would temporarily suspend nuclear test if the U.S. temporarily stops joint military exercises and showed generosity that it is always ready to sit at the negotiating table with the U.S. if it wants to. But the U.S. answered the DPRK's sincere proposal with war maneuvers.
					
					 Tensions persist on the Korean peninsula without dialogue. This is attributable to the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK and joint military exercises for aggression.
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. is persistently pulling up the DPRK, a shameless scheme to cover up its true colors as the wrecker of peace and shift the blame for it on to the DPRK.
					
					 With no rhetoric can it conceal its true colors as disturber of dialogue and peace.
					
					 If it truly wants dialogue, it should stop the old ballad for dialogue and halt the joint military exercise to show its sincere will for dialogue.

articles.title: Minju Joson Brands U.S. as Cesspool of Crimes
articles.content:
Minju Joson Brands U.S. as Cesspool of Crimes
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, a gunfight happened again in Louisiana State, southern region of the U.S., causing nine casualties. This proves that the gun-related crimes are a chronic cancer which can never be treated in the U.S.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday says this in a commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Neither Obama nor his successor can put an end to gun-related crimes in the U.S.
					
					 Even congressmen are helpless before the powerful influence of the U.S. Gun Association called as the largest lobby organization in the country and it is, therefore, quite  impossible to see the adoption of any gun control act there.
					
					 So, Americans cannot escape death due to shooting spree taking place anytime.
					
					 The U.S. is under the sway of all sorts of social evils including gun-related crimes, racism, violence and abuse of women and children.
					
					 This being a hard reality, the U.S. politicians should mind their own business before meddling in issues of other countries.
					
					 But they are busy interfering in affairs of other countries, remaining utterly indifferent to the uneasiness and horror of their people and death of innocent inhabitants.
					
					 They are behaving as if they were "human rights judges," while releasing "human rights report" every year to pull up other countries over their "human rights records".
					
					 With no rhetoric can the U.S. hide its worst human rights abuses.
					
					 The U.S. is, indeed, the world's worst tundra of human rights and veritable hell, notes the commentary.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Iran
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Iran
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us March Forward Dynamically towards Final Victory, Holding Higher the Banner of Songun" was brought out in pamphlet by the Hadian Publishing House of Iran on the occasion of the Day of Songun.
					 The work, which is a speech made by Kim Jong Un at the military parade on the occasion of the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung on April 15, Juche 101 (2012), says the 100-year history of Kim Il Sung's nation clearly proves the immutable truth that outstanding leaders assure the dignity and prosperity of the country and the nation.
					
					 It also clarifies the tasks to glorify the dignity of Songun Korea for all ages and carry out the cause of building a thriving socialist nation successfully.

articles.title: Brazilian Figure Praises Kim Il Sung's Feats
articles.content:
Brazilian Figure Praises Kim Il Sung's Feats
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Acilino Riveiro, chairman of the Brazilian Committee for Remembering Leader Kim Jong Il, issued a statement titled "President Kim Il Sung, a benefactor of Korea's liberation" on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 He said:
					
					 The President liberated the Korean nation from the military occupation by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 He embarked on the road of the struggle for the country and the nation in his teens and formed the Down-with-Imperialism Union in 1926.
					
					 He founded the Juche idea, Songun idea and formed the Korean People's Revolutionary Army.
					
					 Under his leadership the Korean people turned out in the struggle for liberating the country.
					
					 He led the arduous anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory even though there was neither state backing nor support by the regular army.
					
					 The Korean people turned out in the anti-Japanese war, looking up to the President as the sun of the nation and the savior of liberation.
					
					 Korea was liberated on August 15, 1945.
					
					 The feats performed by the President, the benefactor of the liberation, will be kept forever in the minds of not only the Korean people but other people of the world.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Bulgaria
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association published a special bulletin on August 5 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 The bulletin in an article said:
					
					 The Korean people fought arduous struggle to put an end to the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and achieve independence.
					
					 Under the guidance of President Kim Il Sung the Korean revolutionaries waged armed struggle, liberating the country.
					
					 The President founded the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA) on April 25, 1932.
					
					 On August 9, 1945 he ordered the units of the KPRA to commence general offensive.
					
					 KPRA's small units and political operatives active in the homeland aroused broad masses to the final offensive against the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 Korea was liberated from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule on August 15, 1945.
					
					 All the Korean people greeted the liberation with great joy and happiness.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Philippines
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Philippines
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- A Philippine preparatory committee for celebrating the 70 anniversaries of Korea's liberation and the Workers' Party of Korea was formed in Manila on July 16.
					 Rafael Mariano, president of the Philippine Solidarity Committee for Peace and Reunification on the Korean Peninsula, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize events in different cities including the capital and some universities on the occasion of Korea's meaningful days.
					
					 They included events of giving wide publicity to the history of struggle of the DPRK and its people for building socialism and achieving national reunification and signature-collection drives for supporting the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and demanding the withdrawal of the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK and pullback of the U.S. forces from south Korea and conclusion of a peaceful agreement between the DPRK and the U.S.

articles.title: Canadian Party Supports Peace and Reunification of Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Canadian Party Supports Peace and Reunification of Korean Peninsula
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The Communist Party of Canada (Marxist-Leninist) posted an article on its website on August 5 in support of peace and reunification of the Korean peninsula.
					 The article said:
					
					 July 27 marks the 62nd anniversary of the conclusion of the Armistice Agreement (AA) between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					 The Korean people prevailed over the U.S. in the three-year hard-fought war under the guidance of President Kim Il Sung, founder of the DPRK, and the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The U.S. suffered a bitter defeat in the Korean war and could not but sign the AA in the end.
					
					 However, prompted by its geopolitical interests the U.S. turned down the repeated demand of the DPRK for the replacement of the AA with a peace agreement.
					
					 It has employed all possible means to permanently keep its forces in the south side of the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The struggle of the Korean people aspiring after peace, justice, independence and reunification is being supported by the world progressives.
					
					 The Canadian people should indict the U.S. for its crimes, demand it conclude a peace agreement with the DPRK and help averting another Korean war.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Iceland
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Iceland 
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the Workers' Party of Korea and Korea's liberation was formed in Iceland on Aug. 6.
					 Jon Arni Halldorsson, general secretary of the Iceland-DPRK Friendship and Cultural Society, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to adopt a congratulatory letter to Marshal Kim Jong Un and conduct colorful political and cultural events including meeting and photo exhibition on these anniversaries.

articles.title: UN Command in S. Korea Must Be Dissolved: Romanian Body
articles.content:
"UN Command" in S. Korea Must Be Dissolved: Romanian Body 
						
 Pyongyang, August 11 (KCNA) -- The Romanian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted an article titled "Illegal 'UN Command'" on its website on August 3.
					 The article said that "UN Command" in south Korea is illegal in the light of the circumstances of its formation. It went on:
					
					 The U.S. provoked an overall invasion against the DPRK by inciting south Korea on June 25, 1950 and held UNSC to fabricate a "resolution" which branded the DPRK as "aggressor".
					
					 Americans themselves acknowledged the illegality of the "UN Command".
					
					 UN has also denied its relations with the "UN Command".
					
					  On July 27, 2004 and March 3, 2006, spokespersons of UN confirmed that "UN Command" is not the army of UN but the army led by the U.S.
					
					 Furthermore, two resolutions on dissolving "UN Command" were adopted at the 30th UN General Assembly in November 1975.
					
					 The U.S. has been insisting the U.S. forces in south Korea are UN Forces.
					
					 UN should never tolerate its noble name being abused.
					
					 The illegal "UN Command" must be dissolved immediately.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam regresa a Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam regresa a Pyongyang
						
Pyongyang, 11 de agosto (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, regreso el dia 11 a esta capital tras concluir su visita a la Republica Arabe de Egipto para asistir a la ceremonia inaugural del nuevo Canal de Suez. 
					Lo acogieron el vicepresidente del Presidium de la APS, Yang Hyong Sop, el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, el vicecanciller Ri Kil Song y el encargado de negocios a.i. de Egipto acreditado en Corea, Karim Mohamed Hossameldin Hassan Gouda.

articles.title: To Yong Suk secuestrada a Japon se encuentra con sus familiares
articles.content:
To Yong Suk secuestrada a Japon se encuentra con sus familiares
						
ã€€Pyongyang, 11 de agosto (ACNC) -- Segun una informacion del organo correspondiente, la coreana To Yong Suk, repatriada de Japon, quien habia sido secuestrada a este pais isleno, regreso a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y se encontro emocionante con sus familiares.

articles.title: Militares del EPC juran represalia a los yanquis en el Museo de Sinchon
articles.content:
Militares del EPC juran represalia a los yanquis en el Museo de Sinchon
						
Sinchon, 11 de agosto (ACNC) -- Los militares de las unidades del Ejercito Popular de Corea que marchan por la zona del Mar Oeste del pais, organizaron durante su recorrido diversas actividades politicas y culturales entre otros los actos para educar con los rasgos de los grande lideres y sembrar la conviccion firme y los juegos deportivos en la Division Guardia de Tanques 105 "Seul" Ryu Kyong Su y otras unidades militares.
					El dia 11, ellos visitaron el Museo de Sinchon donde escucharon las explicaciones de que el Museo fue remodelado como la base de educacion antiimperialista y antiyanqui y clasista.
					
					Luego, organizaron un acto de jurarse la venganza.
					
					En la ocasion participaron generales, oficiales y soldados del EPC.
					
					Ju Sang Won, director honorario del Museo, encomendo a los militares de nueva generacion la represalia de mil veces tras hablar de los actos de los invasores norteamericanos y los enemigos clasistas que asesinaron cruelmente a los inocentes habitantes.
					
					El oficial del EPC Kim Jong Su y el suboficial Choe Kum Sok dijeron que en los dias de remodelacion del Museo se sintieron otra vez en carne propia que los yanquis y los enemigos clasistas son la banda de canibales y agregaron que afilaron mas la espada clasista.
					
					En su oratoria intitulada "Exclamacion del puente Sokdang", el suboficial Ri Hyok Chol exhorto a vengar mil veces del rencor de ese puente.
					
					En la oratoria "Bestia" y la narracion poetica "Estamos en visperas de la batalla final de represalia", los militares insistieron en que no se puede cambiar el blanco de fusil y la lucha clasista mientras existen los enemigos y juraron escribir las paginas de ignominiosa derrota final en la historia del imperialismo norteamericano, caudillo de la agresion.
					
					Terminado el acto, hubo el tiro de los militares.
					
					Y los caravanistas continuaron su marcha hacia Phanmunjom.

articles.title: Muchos coreanos visitan el lugar de batalla revolucionaria de Rangrim
articles.content:
Muchos coreanos visitan el lugar de batalla revolucionaria de Rangrim
						
Rangrim, 11 de agosto (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 70o aniversario de la liberacion de la patria (15 de agosto), los oficiales y los soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea, los trabajadores de distintos sectores y los jovenes y ninos escolares acuden al lugar de batalla revolucionaria de Rangrim.
					En este lugar estan impregnadas las hazanas revolucionarias del Presidente Kim Il Sung y la Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk, quienes en la segunda mitad de la decada de 1930 dirigieron en la zona de Rangrim los preparativos para ampliar y fortalecer la lucha armada en el  interior del pais y recibir con iniciativa el gran acontecimiento de la liberacion de la patria.
					
					Los visitantes recorren tambien el campamento de Wagalbong, principal campamento de la base secreta del monte Rangrim, que en el periodo de la lucha antijaponesa sirvio de la base regional de direccion para los preparativos de resistencia pannacional y de la base de operaciones, actividades y abastecimiento del Ejercito Revolucionario Popular de Corea.
					
					En agosto y septiembre del 27 (1938) de la Era Juche, el Presidente estuvo en varias ocasiones en Rangrim para dirigir las reuniones de las unidades pequenas y los trabajadores politicos para hacer bien los preparativos de la resistencia pannacional.
					
					Al recorrer la isba de la Comandancia, la sala de escoltas y otros lugares, los visitantes recordaron los esfuerzos del Presidente dedicados a hacer preparacion estricta por el acontecimiento de la liberacion de la patria.
					
					Dieron revistas por el vivaque de Janggol, los campamentos secretos de Sodongsan y Suchaegol y otros objetivos historicos y las consignas inscritas en arboles.
					
					En la zona de Insan del lugar de batalla revolucionaria de Rangrim, los visitantes recorrieron varios puntos del lugar, recordando las hazanas revolucionarias de la Heroina Kim Jong Suk quien difundio los relatos legendarios sobre el Presidente entre los campesinos, que cultivan la tierra desbrozada con fuego, y los levantaron en la lucha patriotica antijaponesa.
